p: The etiology of almost all diseases have been linked to deleterious imbalance between free radicals production and the body's antioxidant capacity to neutralize them. Whenever reactive oxygen species (ROS) are produced in excess of the endogenous antioxidant capacity to mop them, oxidative stress becomes inevitable. During oxidative stress, free radicals wreck havoc on critical macromolecules such as protein, nucleic acids, lipids and carbohydrates. This oxidative attack ultimately results in pathological conditions depending on the organs attacked ( Alugoju etÂ al., 2015).
